title: Are there any good novels and stories written in Hindi recently? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to read modern hindi novel , try Raiders of the Labyrinth : Raiders of the Labyrinth Here you can read the review : Book Review: Raiders of the Labyrinth - भूल भुलेया का रहस्य । पुस्तक समीक्षा P.S. The novel is written by me. Six months back I wanted to read modern hindi literature .I tried some of the books. But it looked to me all the hindi authors are living in the past. So I wrote this book.

If you like the works of Munshi Premchand and Jaishankar Prasad, you would definitely enjoy Nirmal Verma’s  writings. He is my all time favorite. I’m reading his work since my grads days and every time I re-read his work, I find something new. Parinde (1959) an anthology is one of his most outstanding piece of work, which I’m in love till today.
I suggest the name of Uday Prakash. I will add more names later. Other way to explore is go to http://abhivyakti-hindi.org/ and explore new writers.

I like sadat hasan manto.he wrote all his stories in urdu.Hindi urdu is the same language only script is different Before partion he was in bomay There was communal tension in bombay due partition .Ashoke kumar the vetaran actor wasworried as he was not traceable.When he came to Ashok kumar he showed him two caps one of round cap of muslim and gandhi cap of hindu.he told to ashok kumar that both the religion are in his pocket and he used them as per the hindu/muslim .he is totally safe

For stories "Yaad sheher by Neelesh Misra" is one of the interesting books comprising the stories of daily life of a common man. Other book that i would like to suggest is "Woman @ 36 " by Nidhi Nitya. Woman @ 36 is the story of a lady whose  perception and way of living is different from others.
books written by Narendra Kohli......specifically the series 'MahaSamar'. or the most famous by Babu Devakinandan Khatri: Chandrakanta & Chandrakanta: Santati.
